definitions.text: a dramatic work intended for performance by actors on a stage
examples: he wrote several plays but only one was produced on Broadway

definitions.text: a theatrical performance of a drama
examples: the play lasted two hours

definitions.text: a preset plan of action in team sports
examples: the coach drew up the plays for her team

definitions.text: a deliberate coordinated movement requiring dexterity and skill
examples: he made a great maneuver
the runner was out on a play by the shortstop

definitions.text: a state in which action is feasible
examples: the ball was still in play
insiders said the company's stock was in play

definitions.text: utilization or exercise
examples: the play of the imagination

definitions.text: an attempt to get something
examples: they made a futile play for power
he made a bid to gain attention

definitions.text: activity by children that is guided more by imagination than by fixed rules
examples: Freud believed in the utility of play to a small child

definitions.text: (in games or plays or other performances) the time during which play proceeds
examples: rain stopped play in the 4th inning

definitions.text: the removal of constraints
examples: he gave free rein to his impulses
they gave full play to the artist's talent

definitions.text: a weak and tremulous light
examples: the shimmer of colors on iridescent feathers
the play of light on the water

definitions.text: verbal wit or mockery (often at another's expense but not to be taken seriously)
examples: he became a figure of fun
he said it in sport

definitions.text: movement or space for movement
examples: there was too much play in the steering wheel

definitions.text: gay or light-hearted recreational activity for diversion or amusement
examples: it was all done in play
their frolic in the surf threatened to become ugly

definitions.text: (game) the activity of doing something in an agreed succession
examples: it is my turn
it is still my play

definitions.text: the act of playing for stakes in the hope of winning (including the payment of a price for a chance to win a prize)
examples: his gambling cost him a fortune
there was heavy play at the blackjack table

definitions.text: the act using a sword (or other weapon) vigorously and skillfully
participate in games or sport
examples: We played hockey all afternoon
play cards
Pele played for the Brazilian teams in many important matches

definitions.text: act or have an effect in a specified way or with a specific effect or outcome
examples: This factor played only a minor part in his decision
This development played into her hands
I played no role in your dismissal

definitions.text: play on an instrument
examples: The band played all night long

definitions.text: play a role or part
examples: Gielgud played Hamlet
She wants to act Lady Macbeth, but she is too young for the role
She played the servant to her husband's master

definitions.text: be at play; be engaged in playful activity; amuse oneself in a way characteristic of children
examples: The kids were playing outside all day
I used to play with trucks as a little girl

definitions.text: replay (as a melody)
examples: Play it again, Sam
She played the third movement very beautifully

definitions.text: perform music on (a musical instrument)
examples: He plays the flute
Can you play on this old recorder?

definitions.text: pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind
examples: He acted the idiot
She plays deaf when the news are bad

definitions.text: move or seem to move quickly, lightly, or irregularly
examples: The spotlights played on the politicians

definitions.text: bet or wager (money)
examples: He played $20 on the new horse
She plays the races

definitions.text: engage in recreational activities rather than work; occupy oneself in a diversion
examples: On weekends I play
The students all recreate alike

definitions.text: pretend to be somebody in the framework of a game or playful activity
examples: Let's play like I am mommy
Play cowboy and Indians

definitions.text: emit recorded sound
examples: The tape was playing for hours
the stereo was playing Beethoven when I entered

definitions.text: perform on a certain location
examples: The prodigy played Carnegie Hall at the age of 16
She has been playing on Broadway for years

definitions.text: put (a card or piece) into play during a game, or act strategically as if in a card game
examples: He is playing his cards close to his chest
The Democrats still have some cards to play before they will concede the electoral victory

definitions.text: engage in an activity as if it were a game rather than take it seriously
examples: They played games on their opponents
play the stock market
play with her feelings
toy with an idea

definitions.text: behave in a certain way
examples: play safe
play it safe
play fair

definitions.text: cause to emit recorded audio or video
examples: They ran the tapes over and over again
I'll play you my favorite record
He never tires of playing that video

definitions.text: manipulate manually or in one's mind or imagination
examples: She played nervously with her wedding ring
Don't fiddle with the screws
He played with the idea of running for the Senate

definitions.text: use to one's advantage
examples: She plays on her clients' emotions

definitions.text: consider not very seriously
examples: He is trifling with her
She plays with the thought of moving to Tasmania

definitions.text: be received or accepted or interpreted in a specific way
examples: This speech didn't play well with the American public
His remarks played to the suspicions of the committee

definitions.text: behave carelessly or indifferently
examples: Play about with a young girl's affection

definitions.text: cause to move or operate freely within a bounded space
examples: The engine has a wheel that is playing in a rack

definitions.text: perform on a stage or theater
examples: She acts in this play
He acted in `Julius Caesar'
I played in `A Christmas Carol'

definitions.text: be performed or presented for public viewing
examples: What's playing in the local movie theater?
`Cats' has been playing on Broadway for many years

definitions.text: cause to happen or to occur as a consequence
examples: I cannot work a miracle
wreak havoc
bring comments
play a joke
The rain brought relief to the drought-stricken area

definitions.text: discharge or direct or be discharged or directed as if in a continuous stream
examples: play water from a hose
The fountains played all day

definitions.text: make bets
examples: Play the races
play the casinos in Trouville

definitions.text: stake on the outcome of an issue
examples: I bet $100 on that new horse
She played all her money on the dark horse

definitions.text: shoot or hit in a particular manner
examples: She played a good backhand last night

definitions.text: use or move
examples: I had to play my queen

definitions.text: employ in a game or in a specific position
examples: They played him on first base

definitions.text: contend against an opponent in a sport, game, or battle
examples: Princeton plays Yale this weekend
Charlie likes to play Mary

definitions.text: exhaust by allowing to pull on the line
examples: play a hooked fish
